The bug in this code is that you are trying to concatenate a string with an integer, which is not allowed in Python. You need to convert the integer to a string before concatenating. Here is the corrected code:

```python
name = "John"
age = 25
print("My name is " + name + " and I am " + str(age) + " years old.")
```

Alternatively, you can use formatted string literals (f-strings) to achieve the same result:

```python
name = "John"
age = 25
print(f"My name is {name} and I am {age} years old.")
```
